Interface Optimizer.OnlineOnly<E extends EstimationFunction>

Type Parameters:
E - the type of estimation function being optimized
All Superinterfaces:
Optimizer<E>
All Known Implementing Classes:
LeastMeanSquares, PerceptronUpdateRule
Enclosing interface:
Optimizer<E extends EstimationFunction>
@Strategy(CONCRETE) public static interface Optimizer.OnlineOnly<E extends EstimationFunction> extends Optimizer<E>
An Optimizer variant that is restricted to online (sample-by-sample) optimization.

Implementations of OnlineOnly optimize the estimation function one sample at a time rather than processing the entire dataset in a batch. This is common in streaming or online learning contexts.

The default optimize(EstimationFunction, DataSet, ObjectiveFunction) implementation iterates through the dataset and delegates to optimize(EstimationFunction, DataSet.Sample, ObjectiveFunction) for each sample.

  • Method Details

    • optimize

      default void optimize(E estimationFunction, DataSet trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction objective)
      Default implementation of batch optimization for OnlineOnly optimizers. Iterates over the dataset and delegates optimization to the per-sample method.
      Specified by:
      optimize in interface Optimizer<E extends EstimationFunction>
      Parameters:
      estimationFunction - the estimation function (model) to optimize
      trainingSet - the dataset used for optimization
      objective - the objective function that defines the loss and gradients

    • optimize

      void optimize(E estimationFunction, DataSet.Sample sample, ObjectiveFunction objective)
      Optimizes the given estimation function using a single sample and the specified objective function.

      Implementations typically calculate the gradient of the loss function for the given sample and update the parameters of the estimation function immediately, enabling online or stochastic optimization.

      Parameters:
      estimationFunction - the estimation function (model) to optimize
      sample - the training sample used for optimization
      objective - the objective function that defines the loss and gradients
